Metadata.Title: Parsing of External XML Entities Is Disabled
Metadata.DirectLink: Parsing of External XML Entities Is Disabled

Content.Data:
==Applies To==
*iOS applications that use XML documents.
==What to Check For==
Verify that parsing of external XML entities is disabled.
==Why==
Parsing external entities in XML documents may result in injection vulnerabilities.
==How to Check==
To verify that parsing of external XML entities is disabled:
# **Identify the XML parsing library used by the application.** There are two common libraries used in iOS applications for parsing XML: //NSXMLParser// and //LibXML2//. # **Examine code that uses //NSXMLParser//.** Parsing of external entities is disabled by default in //NSXMLParser//. Search for the //setShouldResolveExternalEntities// option to make sure it is not used to enable parsing of external XML entities. # **Examine code that uses //LibXML2//.** Parsing of external entitites needs to be manually disabled in //LibXML2//. Search for the //xmlSetExternalEntityLoader// method of the //parser// class to make sure that it is declared in a way that prevents loading of external XML entities.
==How to Fix==
There are two common ways to parse XML in iOS: //NSXMLParser// and //LibXML2//.
# **//NSXMLParser//.** Parsing of external entities is disabled by default in //NSXMLParser//. Don't explicitly enable parsing of external entities - avoid using the //setShouldResolveExternalEntities// option. # **//LibXML2//.** Parsing of external entitites needs to be manually disabled in //LibXML2//. To disable parsing of external entities, use the //xmlSetExternalEntityLoader// method of the //parser// class to set the external entity loader to be a function that doesn't do anything.
